definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: It is impossible for him to drag the modern society back to the horse-and-buggy era.
sentences.chinese: 他要想把现代社会拉向旧时代，那是不可能的。

sentences.english: Working is like old-time marriage, obviously you got no happiness, but still you have to live with it.
sentences.chinese: 上班就像旧时代的婚姻，明明不幸福，还得长相厮守。

sentences.english: From the ashes of the old times a new world will arise.
sentences.chinese: 新世界将从旧时代的灰烬中华丽诞生。

sentences.english: And with the hot bats came some good old-fashioned excitement in the Bronx.
sentences.chinese: 还有，一些像是来自旧时代布隆克斯区的火热支援。

sentences.english: They believed the nation was a "new order for the ages."
sentences.chinese: 因为奠基者们认为，这个国家是“旧时代的新秩序”。

sentences.english: They look at it as a natural passing from old age to senility .
sentences.chinese: 他们看看它作为一个自然通过从旧时代到衰老。

sentences.english: Since the New Age has a pre-occupation with and a return to the skills and beliefs of a past eras.
sentences.chinese: 因为新时代主张关注并回归至旧时代的技巧和信仰。

sentences.english: Making a fresh start manifesting the past ages steadiness, is hard , struggle , dim , lonely.
sentences.chinese: 更张显出旧时代的稳重，艰苦，奋斗，暗淡，孤独。

sentences.english: Around 20 years ago software engineering was compared to old-time blacksmithing.
sentences.chinese: 大约二十多年前，软件工程业被比喻成旧时代的打铁。

sentences.english: It is like tunes of the old time, playing in pathos on the gramophone.
sentences.chinese: 它像旧时代的曲调，在激情演奏的留声机。

sentences.english: The railway station in Windhoek is a survivor from the old days.
sentences.chinese: 温德和克火车站从旧时代保留至今。

definition: a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties)/age/era/period/CL:個|个[ge4]

the not-very-distant past/modern times, excluding recent decades/(in the context of Chinese history) the period from the Opium Wars until the May 4th Movement (mid-19th century to 1919)/capitalist times (pre-1949)
